title: Vertice and Foci
text: Consider whether the major axis lies on the $$x-$$ or y-axis.
speech: Consider whether the major axis lies on the  x minus  or y-axis.
pacedSpeech: Consider whether the major axis lies on the   x minus

title: Standard Equation Form
text: The form of the standard equation is $$c^2=a^2-b^2$$, given $$a=vertices$$ and $$c=foci$$.
speech: The form of the standard equation is  c squared is equal to, a squared minus b squared , given  a is equal to, vertices  and  c, is equal to foci .
pacedSpeech: The form of the standard equation is   c squared is equal to, a squared minus b squared
, given   a is equal to, vertices
and   c, is equal to foci

title: Midpoint Formula
text: Using the midpoint formula, identify the coordinate for the point halfway between the vertices
speech: Using the midpoint formula, identify the coordinate for the point halfway between the vertices
pacedSpeech: Using the midpoint formula, identify the coordinate for the point halfway between the vertices

title: Solving for a
text: Solve for a by finding the distance between the y-coordinates of the vertices.
speech: Solve for a by finding the distance between the y-coordinates of the vertices.
pacedSpeech: Solve for a by finding the distance between the y-coordinates of the vertices.

title: Solving for c
text: Solve for c using the known information on the foci.
speech: Solve for c using the known information on the foci.
pacedSpeech: Solve for c using the known information on the foci.

title: Solving for $$b$$
speech: Solve for  b  using the equation  c squared, is equal to, a squared minus b squared
pacedSpeech: using the equation   c squared, is equal to, a squared minus b squared

title: Plugging in the Values
text: Plug in the values for $$h$$, k, a, and $$b$$ into the standard form equation for an ellipse.
speech: Plug in the values for  h , k, a, and  b,  into the standard form equation for an ellipse.
